data.title: Red Hatters enjoyed Joe's
data.text:
Approx 25 Red Hat ladies from my retirement park enjoyed a delightful lunch at Joe's Crab Shack this week.  We all  ordered separately.  I was extremely impressed that all the meals arrived within only a minute or so of each other..I had coconut shrimp which was superb..Afterwards a couple of the ladies said that their fish was "ok"
Service was good..

data.title: going down hill
data.text: When Joes first opened we loved it,  and looked forward to return, over the past few years it started to go down.  waitress made mistakes, chef made mistakes, Each time we went the good things got fewer and the bad got more.  we went yesterday, ( for the last time )   we are not going back.

data.title: Poor service and average food
data.text: Stopped by for lunch with friends.  We must have waited at least 10 minutes before a waiter came for drinks.  He was not friendly at all.  I had the fish tacos, they were average at best.  My husband had the Fish & Chips.  He said they were good.  This is a tourist trap.  Average food with high prices.

data.title: Amazing sunset
data.text: We were recommended Joes Crab Shack by a local   I had the all you can eat shrimp meal for $19.99.  Our friends had the fish and chips and the fish and shrimp. The different sorts of shrimp were, plain and cold, deep fried coconut and crispy shrimp with fries and dips.  You could have as much as you wanted. I couldn't manage any more but my husband had another portion of crispy shrimp. The shrimp were huge and tasty !! The ladies had happy hour with Rita's (Margaritas!! ) we were given the unusual glass it came in.  We also drank the Yeungling draft beer. You could have it either in a 22 oz or 16oz glass. The food was freshly cooked and hot. The service was good. It's a lovely situation by the river. Beautiful sunset.

data.title: There are better choices
data.text: We live near here and thought we'd give it a try.  Not our best idea.  The service is slow and innatentive, the place is noisy, the tables are jammed together, and the food was okay at best.  There are too many nicer places in the area, and the management at Joe's doesn't seem to want to improve the place.

data.title: Great Place to eat by the water.
data.text: Lunch or dinner with a beautiful view of the river from the outside patio. Inside has plenty of room and sports bar facilities.

data.title: A sunset Dinner that can not be beat!
data.text: Located just right for a romantic and stunning sunset. Great food, great service and a comfortable all around feeling. Highly recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Very good for a chain restaurant
data.text: Nice water views, outside dining, good menu with lots of choices.  Wait staff is friendly and helpful, food is priced well as are drinks.  Fast service, small parking lot outside with street and other lots in the area.  The Mahi tacos are very good with decent portions for lunch.

data.title: Great family restaurant
data.text: Excellent food and service. We will be back! I celebrated my birthday there tonight with my family and friends and everyone enjoyed there meal. We were entertained and service was great. I recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.

data.title: Not so good food
data.text: First time here.  We have been to Joes at other locations and this was very disappointing.  Good was not good.  Tasteless and greasy.  Service was ok but not great.  The bloody Mary was the high point.  Has very limited parking as well.  We will not be back here.

data.title: Great Seafood and a View Too
data.text: We were seated right at a window on the Marina the sunset view was great but that was not all, the food was delicious and the service was fast.  Love the seafood here and have visited many other times just never reviewed it.  Will return again.

data.title: FOR SEAFOOD LOVERS!!!
data.text: Joe's Crab Shack is great if you love seafood. Restaurant is essentially in a great location.  Service & establishment was average. I am truly a seafood lover but would not probably visit Joe Crab Shack because in my opinion food is over priced for what you get.  Overall first experience and food was great...

data.title: What happened?
data.text: Visited my favorite restaurant in Ft. Myers, FL, 9/10/2016.  Waitress brought menu,  asked if they had changed the menu,  she stated yes they were trying to cut back.  Waitress did not give us her name like they used to do.  Ordered two tall draft beers., received  short beers in tall glasses.  I ordered the coconut shrimp, way overcooked.  Coconut does not taste so good burnt,  my guest ordered stuffed shrimp,  no stuffing, just undercooked bacon and shrimp. Broccoli was good.  coleslaw was very dry.  sauce for coconut shrimp was not good at all. Will not return to this place again.  Paid the bill which they do not give you an itemized bill, did not complain.   Really should have returned both dinners.

data.title: Does not deserve one star
data.text: We went to celebrate our daughters birthday at Joe's crab shack this evening, What a mistake! First, Our waitress seemed to have an attitude from the start and it went down hill from there. She never asked if we wanted our drinks refilled and then after waiting for our food for 1 hour I hunted the manager down to tell him what was going on. He was very nice but by this it was just to late. Finally our food came out....Sort of....The waitress never put my mothers dinner order in! Five meals come out and it is a party of six, When hers did come her food was very good the rest was HORRIBLE! My future son in laws meal was ice cold. I ordered salmon and it was tasteless and dry. All of it was terrible. The manager did comp the meal which is nice since we couldn't eat it. I came home and had oatmeal for dinner.  Just a horrible experience all the way around.

data.title: location ideal for an evening of nice food
data.text: location ideal for an evening of nice food, we had the sampler and some crab, food was very good, to bad they did not serve belgian beers like stella artois

data.title: Good Seafood
data.text: Love the fish and chips!  Great view of the river!  Very casual.  Moderately priced restaraunt along the Caloosahatchee River.

data.title: IT'S ON THE WATER WHAT CAN YOU SAY ?
data.text: Went with a group of about 12 people ,so took a little time but all good , Not new England seafood by any stretch of the imagination . crabs were very good but to much work for me .

data.title: GREAT FOOD
data.text: Our experience was great. I dont eat seafood but my family does and they loved it. My steak was amazing. The bibs are making me laugh with the writing our waiter put.

data.title: AYCE Crab Legs! Fantastic Service
data.text: Recently moved to area and have been looking for all you can eat crab legs. Joe's was first one we found so decided to give it a try. Was not crowded at all when we arrived around 630/7. Was greeted by a nasty host who was mad she had to work....sat immediately by huge picture window overlooking the river, beautiful! Our server was terrific and was very kind. She kept our drinks refilled and offered wonder specialty drinks. Answered all of our questions about the area and made nice small talk. Overall the evening was very pleasurable and will be returning with friends and family.

data.title: birthday
data.text: joes crab shack is a great place for birthday partys drinks are good with 2-4-1s now and then, they have great crab and trimmings.
